Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2018 02:07PM - edited Jun 3, 2018 02:07PM by Aliceinchains I had all the major signs: inverted nipple, high vascularity, large mass,bleeding from nipple, severe weight loss, BIRADS 4 from all tests. Yet the pathology said no. We knew better. I wasn't diagnosed until after the DMX. Stay vigilant in getting answers should things not add up. (6 biopsieds Ihad total)

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2018 08:59AM Aliceinchains wrote: I am literally going through the same thing. The radiologists and my new breast surgeon all say that images (mammogram and ultrasound) point to cancer yet the biopsies taken (2 in the right breast and 4 in the left) show nothing. Before I can move on to the next step I’ll have an MRI done. I’m anxious to get some answers. It’s not even a disease that mimics cancer or that would’ve been brought up up-front. These doctors are amazing and never give up. Let’s do the same. I’m here for ylu

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2018 02:15PM Aliceinchains wrote: @hopedreams, so sorry! Chemo brain. I have HER2+ left breast, also full of DCIS. HER2+ I’m unsure of stage. My situation was more unique due to pathology. I had all major signs of BC including bleeding from the nipple. BIRADS 4 on all tests but damn pathology did not match up to the cancer we weee seeing on screen. It wasn’t until I demanded the DMX that they found me to be full of it in my left breast at pathology. Then I had to have sentinel node and chemo port surgery. Now I’m on chemo. I guess they don’t mess around with HER2+. Chemo and Herceptin until August and then continue Herceptin until summer of 2019. I have begged for surgery for Crohns!!!! This time I might get my way after chemo because of the impact of this treatment
